required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: First Relief Treatment for Peripheral Neuropathy
clinical_study.official_title: To Prove the Effectiveness of PENS Therapy With Peripheral Neuropathy

brief_summary.textblock: To prove the effectiveness of Percutaneous Electrical Neuro-stimulation therapy for the treatment of conditions associated with peripheral neuropathy, in a double-blind environment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: According to the patients condition and other factors expected to reduce pain in 4th week of the treatment
primary_outcome.description: This treatments effective outcome will be, "Percutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation therapy will have the ability to reduce the pain and other conditions regarding peripheral neuropathy" which can be verified through "Biothesiometer" parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Check for delay of Re-occurrence of pain within a short time
secondary_outcome.description: After the treatment of 4th week the pain will be reduced and the treatment is continued for other 3 weeks where the booster dose is applied for the assurance of delay of pain which is evaluated manually by the medical personals after 90 days of booster dose treatment

other_outcome.measure: Complete reduction of conditions associated with peripheral neuropathy
other_outcome.description: After the overall treatment has been completed the conditions associated with peripheral neuropathy will be completely reduced and the occurrence of the pain will be stopped which can be verified and evaluated through "Biothesiometer" parameters.

arm_group.description: Group A will be treated with First Relief Treatment at standard stimulation.
Group B will be treated with First Relief Treatment at sweep stimulation.
Group C will be treated with First Relief Treatment, receiving a placebo.(dummy device with no electrical stimulation)

intervention.description: To prove the effectiveness of Percutaneous Electrical Neuro-stimulation therapy for the treatment of conditions associated with peripheral neuropathy, in a double-blind environment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Neuropathy pain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient with inbuilt pacemakers or any other devices which allows current into the body, pregnant ladies.
